page.title: 19HERITAGE TRAIL
page.content: On June 11th our class walked round part of the Heritage Trail with Councillor Bell. We started in the Council Chambers. This is a impressive room, with a large painting of Queen Victoria. There also were photograghs of Dornoch and its golfing history. We went to St. Michael's which is the oldest house in Dornoch. Across the road there is an arched bridge which was once the only crossing over the burn. We stopped at the Mercat Cross. Here fairs and markets were held. The lane across the road was known as "Dog Steet" because shepherds left their dogs there. In the graveyard there is a stone which was used to measure cloth. We continued into the cathedral which was built in 1224, under Gilbert the Bishop of Caithness. It was burned in 1570 and restored in the 19th century. It is now a fine building.
